questions.prompt: "A jump to the left", "a step to the right", "bring your knees in tight", and "pelvic thrust" are some of the instructions in what anthemic dance from a 1973 rock musical (note, name the dance)?
The Latin name for a particular ancient city is, by coincidence, also the anatomical name for the largest part of the hip bone. What is that name?
In French cooking, béchamel sauce is simply a white sauce made with a roux (butter and flour) and milk. Béchamel sauce with cheese added (typically Gruyère) becomes what other French sauce?
In 1901, J.P. Morgan purchased the company that would become US Steel for $480 million primarily from what man, a Scottish-born industrialist who had helped form his namesake steel company in 1889?
Former ESPN SportsCenter host Kevin Frazier is the current anchor for what daily news program that premiered with hosts Mary Hart and Ron Hendren in September 1981?
The most essential and enduring invention of American engineer Frank Zamboni is used by its operators primarily in what type of facility?
